p: The dengue outbreak that occurred in Hangzhou was the most serious epidemic in the history of Zhejiang Province, China. The epidemic lasted nearly four months. The combination of rapid development of globalization, suitable meteorological conditions, high susceptibility of the population and delayed diagnosis of imported dengue cases led to this outbreak [ 8, 38â€“ 40]. The gender and age distribution in this outbreak were attributed to the exposure chances [ 8].
